text.div:
<!-- Resources -->
<!-- Definition -->
<ValueSet xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
 <!-- from Element: extension -->
 <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
 <text><!-- 0..1 Narrative Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation --></text>
 <contained><!-- 0..* Resource Contained, inline Resources --></contained>
 <identifier value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Logical id to reference this value set § -->
 <version value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Logical id for this version of the value set § -->
 <name value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Informal name for this value set § -->
 <purpose value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Textual description of the intended scope and use -->
 <immutable value="[boolean]"/><!-- 0..1 Indicates whether or not any change to the content logical definition may occur -->
 <publisher value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Name of the publisher (Organization or individual) § -->
 <telecom><!-- 0..* Contact Contact information of the publisher § --></telecom>
 <description value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Human language description of the value set § -->
 <copyright value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Publishing restrictions for the value set -->
 <status value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 draft | active | retired § -->
 <experimental value="[boolean]"/><!-- 1..1 If for testing purposes, not real usage § -->
 <extensible value="[boolean]"/><!-- 0..1 Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding -->
 <date value="[dateTime]"/><!-- 0..1 Date for given status § -->
 <stableDate value="[date]"/><!-- 0..1 Fixed date for the version of all referenced code systems and value sets -->
 <define>  <!--  0..1 When value set defines its own codes § -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <system value="[uri]"/><!-- 1..1 URI to identify the code system § -->
  <version value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Version of this system § -->
  <caseSensitive value="[boolean]"/><!-- 0..1 If code comparison is case sensitive § -->
  <concept>  <!-- 0..* Concepts in the code system -->
   <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
   <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
   <code value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 Code that identifies concept -->
   <abstract value="[boolean]"/><!-- 0..1 If this code is not for use as a real concept -->
   <display value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Text to Display to the user -->
   <definition value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Formal Definition -->
   <concept><!-- 0..* Content as for ValueSet.define.concept Child Concepts (is-a / contains) --></concept>
  </concept>
 </define>
 <compose>  <!--  0..1 When value set includes codes from elsewhere -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <import value="[uri]"/><!--  0..* Import the contents of another value set § -->
  <include>  0..* =ConceptSet  <!--  0..* Include one or more codes from a code system § -->
   <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
   <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
   <system value="[uri]"/><!-- 1..1 The system the codes come from § -->
   <version value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Specific version of the code system referred to § -->
   <code value="[code]"/><!-- 0..* Code or concept from system -->
   <filter>  <!-- 0..* Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships) -->
    <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
    <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
    <property value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 A property defined by the code system -->
    <op value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 = | is-a | is-not-a | regex | in | not in -->
    <value value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 Code from the system, or regex criteria -->
   </filter>
  </include>
  <exclude><!--  0..* Content as for ValueSet.compose.include Explicitly exclude codes --></exclude>
 </compose>
 <expansion>  <!--  0..1 When value set is an expansion -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <identifier><!-- 0..1 Identifier Uniquely identifies this expansion --></identifier>
  <timestamp value="[instant]"/><!-- 1..1 Time valueset expansion happened -->
  <contains>  <!-- 0..* Codes in the value set -->
   <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
   <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
   <system value="[uri]"/><!-- 0..1 System value for the code -->
   <code value="[code]"/><!--  0..1 Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code -->
   <display value="[string]"/><!--  0..1 User display for the concept -->
   <contains><!-- 0..* Content as for ValueSet.expansion.contains Codes contained in this concept --></contains>
  </contains>
 </expansion>
</ValueSet>

name: Shareable ValueSet
description: Enforces the minimum information set for the value set metadata required by HL7 and other organisations that share and publish value sets

definition.short: A set of codes drawn from one or more code systems
definition.formal: A value set specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Logical id to reference this value set
definition.formal: The identifier that is used to identify this value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique OID, UUID, or URI).

definition.short: Logical id for this version of the value set
definition.formal: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp.
definition.comments: There may be multiple resource versions of the value set that have the same identifier.

definition.short: Informal name for this value set
definition.formal: A free text natural language name describing the value set.
definition.comments: Not expected to be unique.

definition.short: Textual description of the intended scope and use
definition.formal: This should describe “the semantic space" to be included in the value set. This can also describe the approach taken to build the value set.
definition.comments: Any significantly meaningful change in this implies a different value set, rather than a new version.  This item is a key component for the meaning of the value set.

definition.short: Indicates whether or not any change to the content logical definition may occur
definition.formal: If this is set to ‘true’, then no new versions of the content logical definition can be created.  Note: Other metadata might still change.
definition.comments:
Normally immutability is set to ‘false’, which is the default assumption if it is not populated.  Note that the implication is that if this is set to ‘true’, there may be only one Value Set Version for this Definition. Immutability tends to be set to ‘true’ in one of two cases:
- Where the value set, by the nature of its usage, cannot change.  For example "All specializations of ACT in ActClassCode"
- Where there's no safe way to express the "Purpose" such that someone else could safely make changes to the value set definition
Source workflow control must guarantee that the same URI always yields the same definition.

definition.short: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
definition.formal: The name of the individual or organization that published the value set.
definition.comments: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

definition.formal: Contacts of the publisher to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
definition.comments: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

definition.short: Human language description of the value set
definition.formal: A free text natural language description of the use of the value set - reason for definition, conditions of use, etc. The description may include a list of.
definition.comments: The description is not intended to describe the semantics of the Value Set - there are no intrinsic semantics separate from the codes contained in its expansion. The description should capture its intended use, which is needed for ensuring integrity for its use in models across future changes.

definition.short: Publishing restrictions for the value set
definition.formal: A copyright statement relating to the value set and/or its contents. These are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the value set.
definition.comments: Frequently, the copyright differs between the value set, and codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

definition.formal: The status of the value set.
definition.comments: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not.

binding.name: ValueSetStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map

definition.short: If for testing purposes, not real usage
definition.formal: This valueset was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
definition.comments: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not.

definition.short: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding
definition.formal: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding or not.
The date that the value set status was last changed.
definition.comments: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the value set.

definition.short: Fixed date for the version of all referenced code systems and value sets
definition.formal: If a Stability Date is expanded by evaluating the Content Logical Definition using the current version of all referenced code system(s) and value sets as of the Stability Date.
definition.comments: With a defined Stability Date the value set is considered "Static".  Otherwise, the value set is considered to be "Dynamic" and may have different expansions as underlying code systems and/or value sets evolve.

definition.short: When value set defines its own codes
definition.formal: When value set defines its own codes.

definition.short: URI to identify the code system
definition.formal: URI to identify the code system.

The version of this code system that defines the codes. Note that the version is optional because a well maintained code system does not suffer from versioning, and therefore the version does not need to be maintained. However many code systems are not well maintained, and the version needs to be defined and tracked.

definition.short: If code comparison is case sensitive
definition.formal: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.
definition.comments: If this value is missing, then it is not specified whether a code system is case sensitive or not. When the rule is not known, Postel's law should be followed: produce codes with the correct case, and accept codes in any case. This element is primarily provided to support validation software.

definition.formal: Concepts in the code system.

definition.formal: Code that identifies concept.

definition.short: If this code is not for use as a real concept
definition.formal: If this code is not for use as a real concept.

definition.short: Text to Display to the user
definition.formal: Text to Display to the user.

The formal definition of the concept. Formal definitions are not required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems without them, but they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.
Child Concepts (is-a / contains).

definition.short: Import the contents of another value set
definition.formal: Includes the contents of the referenced value set as a part of the contents of this value set.
definition.comments: The value set URI is either a logical reference to a defined value set such as a SNOMED CT reference set, or a literal reference to a value set definition (not an expansion). If the reference is a logical one, it may not reference a actual FHIR value set resource; in this case, the referenced definition of a set of coded values needs to be clear about how versions are resolved.

definition.short: Include one or more codes from a code system
definition.formal: Include one or more codes from a code system.
definition.comments: If there are no codes or filters, the entire code system is included.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: The system the codes come from
definition.formal: The code system from which the selected codes come from.
definition.comments: See [[Coding.system]] for further documentation.

definition.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
definition.formal: The version of the code system that the codes are selected from.
definition.comments: This is used when selecting the descendents of a concept - they may change between versions. If no version is specified, then the exact contents of the value set may not be known until a context of use binds it to a particular version.

definition.formal: Specifies a code or concept to be included or excluded. The list of codes is considered ordered, though the order may not have any particular significance.
definition.comments: Expressions are allowed if defined by the underlying code system.

definition.short: Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships)
definition.formal: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they SHALL all be true.
definition.comments: Selecting codes by specifying filters based on properties is only possible where the underlying code system defines appropriate properties. Note that in some cases, the underlying code system defines the logical concepts but not the literal codes for the concepts. In such cases, the literal definitions may be provided by a third party.

definition.short: A property defined by the code system
definition.formal: A code that identifies a property defined in the code system.

definition.short: = | is-a | is-not-a | regex | in | not in
definition.formal: The kind of operation to perform as a part of the filter criteria.

binding.name: FilterOperator
binding.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter

definition.short: Code from the system, or regex criteria
definition.formal: The match value may be either a code defined by the system, or a string value which is used a regex match on the literal string of the property value.
definition.comments: Use regex matching with care - full regex matching on every SNOMED CT term is prohibitive, for example.

definition.formal: Exclude one or more codes from the value set.
definition.comments: Usually this is used to selectively exclude codes that were included by subsumption in the inclusions.

definition.short: When value set is an expansion
definition.formal: When value set is an expansion.

definition.formal: An identifier that uniquely identifies this expansion of the valueset. Systems may re-use the same identifier as long as the expansion and the definition remain the same, but are not required to do so.

definition.formal: System value for the code.

definition.short: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code
